name: Amanda Butler
text: Jessie showed up quickly for a septic tank emergency at my daughters rental property. He couldn't do the work that day due to pouring rain, but he came up with a temporary fix so our renters wouldn't be inconvenienced. He was there bright and early the following day, got the job done, and made repairs to an improperly installed septic tank. He showed me the parts that had to be replaced and explained to me in detail the work he was doing. He even returned the next day to make sure everything was running properly and to fix another little issue the original installer had left so the children living there wouldn't get hurt. I would recommend J&M to anyone needing septic or backhoe work.

name: John Griffin
text: We hired Josh in May, 2020 to remove 6 trees and grind the stumps. He came out to our home on a Friday to do the job, cut down three trees, and called us to see if we would be willing to meet him with payment, saying, "we are going to stay out here until the job is done." He cashed our check THAT DAY and never came back. We tried for months to get him to come back out, but he always had some excuse and would not return our money. We are in the process of suing him to retrieve our funds. DO NOT MAKE THE SAME MISTAKE WE MADE.

text: J & H is a very customer oriented, professional and safety focused business. They removed trees in my yard that were almost six feet in diameter, very tall and full without any disturbances to adjoining properties or fences.  Prices are very reasonable for the quality of work provided.  Their work ethics are impeccable; they were on time each day, courteous and never left a messy area.  All tree stumps were completely grind down and all debris removed.  I highly recommend this company.

text:
I arranged for J&H to do some pruning and tree removal in my Mom's yard in Dothan. I set up the original appointment via e-mail. I live 5 time zones away and coordinated the work for the week I was at my Mom's. Josh came by, gave me an estimate, and recommended removal of two trees. Both were close to the house, one was a 50-ft oak tree.  Josh was able to reschedule a day earlier than he originally projected.

About 6 hours of work, and the tree felling operations went flawlessly dropping right between house and fence. The crew was professional, Josh was personally meticulous about cleaning and power blowing yard clean, especially around pool. Josh owns and runs this business and of course will be saturated with calls after severe weather events.  That's why I elected to have the work done on my schedule, not Mother Nature's. I had some questions after the work was completed and Josh provided timely responses and follow up to my questions. I'd hire him again.

resp.text: Thanks Robert we really appreciate the review.

name: Rick McCleskey
text:
My first impression and review was only one star since they failed to show up or call with a reason for not showing up to give an estimate on tree removal,,,not once, but twice.
EDIT:  Several days later, they called, made an appointment for an estimate and showed up on time.  Their price quote was fair and less than others I had received so they were hired.
Due to weather and additional trees downed, what was supposed to be a 3 day job  has turned into 5 .   J &H has been great.. They've had as many as 10 to.12 workers here at one time and ALL were very polite and hard working. I'm impressed with the personnel and equipment they have.
I can honestly say,  I'm happy with their work and I'm very picky.  Josh and his personnel are the best and you won't be disappointed if you hire them.. Just be patient if can't get in touch with them right away.

Called them a second time and the prices were now out of sight.

Urban Cowgill

name: Nick Pronesti
text: The team is very polite and did do a good job  however I am still struggling with the price I paid and how they changed the price on me from original visit to the next. When they came out to bid us Charles told me $2,000 but that it was a couple weeks before he could get to me. I checked in periodically. When they finally could get to me they raised the price to $3,000. We were semi-desperate because of the hurricane season and what we had just seen sally do. We spent $3,000 for them to remove 2 large branches from an oak tree over our house. After speaking to other tree companies this should have been around $1,800. In hindsight we wish we would have looked around more.

resp.text: Nick, we are so sorry that we didn’t know of your concerns sooner. Looking back on our records, we see that the scope of work changed after the initial bid was placed, and that’s where the price difference came from. However, our company is built on customer satisfaction, and we want to do whatever we can to change your opinion of us from 3 star to 5 star. Please don’t hesitate to reach out. 251-359-6777.

text: I have nothing but good things to say about this company. I inquired about having my driveway repaired and they were out to my house within a few days. Scout was amazing and got the job done exactly how I imagined it would be. Thank y’all so much!

text: I myself own a small civil contracting company and use Garrett Contracting for a lot of my larger excavation projects as well as gravel, sand and slag deliveries. Reliable and affordable.

name: Donnie Pierce
text: We hired Garret Contracting to build a dirt pad for a horse barn. Right away I noticed the great communication between Josh and I. He came out to give us a quote within 24 hours of contacting him and gave us a good, compatible price shortly after. Josh has this positive vibe about him and truly cares about the customer. He is friendly, helpful, professional, reliable and super polite. Unlike other companies I had contacted, he was able to give us a quicker time frame and set us up for about 2 weeks out. Josh gave prompt replies to questions and updated us as the projected date approached. On the construction day he and his crew showed up exactly on time and started to work on the project without any delay. His crew was also very polite and friendly and accommodated our needs. Josh's crew worked efficiently and never took a break and the job was done sooner than we expected. Josh and his crew are particular about their job and giving it their all to meet or exceed the customers expectations. Josh makes sure to check on the progress in between and again once the job is complete. Customer satisfaction is important to him. It has been a real pleasure to work with Josh and I hope he continues to stay true to himself and the way he treats people. His momma raised him right! "Thank you" doesn't seem to be enough to say to Josh and his crew. Right now it's just a "pile of dirt", but it is part of making our dreams come true. It's much more than just a JOB WELL DONE!

name: Paul Pedersen
text:
Not reliable.

I've been trying for over a month to get this company to come out and give me an estimate.

text: Great company

name: Ben Smallwood
text: Drive like reckless mongoloids through residential neighborhoods. I have them on video running though stop signs without even hitting the breaks. Will be turning over video to police. Maybe your careless management will do something when they have to pay fines.

name: Alex Mitchell
text: I don’t know if they do good work but they drive their overloaded trucks like angry teenagers. Slug gravel in my windshield in the opposite lane and refused to do anything.

name: Sarah Capps
text: They installed our septic system that should have out lasted us, but I'll be reasonable It should have lasted at least 20 years.  It had to be a mound system, they asked if they could get top soil from our property,  because that would be cheaper. (Warning, if you need mound, that means your soil doesn't drain, getting soil from your own property is a bad idea) With in a year there were some cave in spots, the did come out and respect the warranty, but complained that we drove on it,  we did not drive on it.  When our septic field failed less that 5 years after it was installed, we called to see if they would come fix it. They said it wasn't under warranty and would not help us at all.  We knew it wasn't under warranty but the county septic engineer said we should contact them to come fix their work because they put it in they are familiar with it. They they asked where it was leaking,  and said if it was off the side it was our fault, (note I wasn't trying to place blame, I was trying to get help) The leak is on the top, close to where the main pipe should connect into the dome system.  I was then told I would save a LOT of money if we just had a load of land fill and put it on top, and that would "fix" the problem. I told that to the county engineer, and was informed that would be illegal, and just cause more problems, and we would be liable for an Illegal fix, for several reasons, 1- we are not licensed or certified to work on a septic field, even though it is our own. 2- we would not have pulled a permit for the fix, which if we ever sold the house and they found out about the fix we would be liable.  So very dishonest company.

name: Reid Sanderson
text: These dump trucks I’ve caught going 70mph+ in a 45, they drive by house (ON A RESIDENTIAL STREET) so fast, one by the grace of God ALMOST hit my 2 year old that thinks it’s funny to run the opposite direction of his mom! That man is lucky I didn’t have time to shoot his tires out and wait for the police. SLOW DOWN

name: Dave Diaz
text: The day after Thanksgiving!!!  I called at 8:30 in the morning and had the septic pumped and ground filled back in before noon.  I was told the cost up front on the phone and there where ZERO hidden add-on charges.  Great service!  Highly recommended.

name: Jason Estaphan
text:
When my house was 6 years old I decided to have Beckham conduct a preventive maintenance inspection and service of my septic system.  The technician that came out was very friendly and happily answered all my questions.  This is my first house with a septic system so I had a great deal of questions.  The technician explained to me what he was inspecting for as well as explaining the concept of operation for a healthy system.  He also taught me how to keep my system healthy between services as well as tasks I could perform myself to avoid the cost of a service visit if I experience some common minor issues with my system.
I do not list prices in reviews since prices can always change, but I will say that I was surprised how reasonable the price was considering the time and effort involved in properly inspecting my system.  I have recommended Beckham to quite a few of my neighbors and co-workers since I received my service and have not heard anything negative from anyone.

name: Tim Brooks
text: I have an early 1950s vintage house with same era septic tank.  I bought the house about 7 years ago and had no clue where the tank was but had a general idea.  Nick and crew came in, found the tank in 20-30 seconds, marked off approximately where it was, dug down to it and sure enough there it was, just as they'd suspected.  It was, in fact, the source of my problems in the house.  It was full of water.  They cleaned it out, resealed and covered it and i'm good for another 3 to 5 years.  Great job fellas and enjoyed chewing the cud with yall while being schooled on what my problem was and given options on how to address them going forward after this stop-gap measure.  Good stuff Beckham Septic.

name: Glen Woodard
text: Great Service! We had a sewage back-up problem with our septic tank/system. Beckham team (Heath and Ziebol) went out of their way to work us into the schedule quickly. When they arrived they pumped the tank and took the few extra minutes to point out problem areas. The workers were friendly, courteous and careful with the truck. They also provided options for related/future repairs without selling me anything specific.

name: Elena Wyatt
text: Ben Beckham sent a crew (Wayne, Danny, and Drew) out to put in a new septic tank at our farm.  They are courteous and hard working!  A thousand recommendations for Beckham Septic tank company.  Clean, thorough and a great job.

Asking my family member that “knows them” also call to no avail. Had to hire another service to take over and pump and now repair the tank. Plumbing was never sealed off properly. Exceptional honest people!! I'd recommend ROSSER'S to anyone!! Saved the number in my phone just in case I need to give it away with stellar recommendations.
